result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony D Hill

records.addlTxt:
8:57 AM Defendant Tony D Hill not in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Tony D Hill.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn being sentenced in Iowa County on 11/9, requesting STC after that. Address verified.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Tony D Hill
Current: c/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703   (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: 1819 Aberg Ave # D, Madison, WI 53704

10:29 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moved for finding of transactional relation between Count 1 & 3. No objection. Court made finding. State called first witness. Trooper McArdle duly sworn & testified. Direct by State. Cross by defense. State moved for bind over. No objection by defense. Court granted motion.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:43 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State indicated that witness has not appeared and requested set over. Defense moved to dismiss Complaint. Court denied motion to dismiss to dismiss and found good cause to set over.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

01:38 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Reissued from 22CF1555.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
